t: Job 31
“I*pn made a covenant with my eyes not*ld to look lustfully at a young woman.
For*ln what is our lot from God above, our*ld heritage from the Almighty on high?
Is*ln it not ruin for the wicked, disaster*ld for those who do wrong?
Does*ln he not see my ways and*ld count my every step?
“If*pn I have walked with falsehood or*ld my foot has hurried after deceit—
let*ln God weigh me in honest scales and*ld he will know that I am blameless—

then*ln may others eat what I have sown, and*ld may my crops be uprooted.
“If*pn my heart has been enticed by a woman, or*ld if I have lurked at my neighbor’s door,

For*ln that would have been wicked, a*ld sin to be judged.

“If*pn I have denied justice to any of my servants, whether*ld male or female, when*ld they had a grievance against me,
what*ln will I do when God confronts me? What*ld will I answer when called to account?
Did*ln not he who made me in the womb make them? Did*ld not the same one form us both within our mothers?
“If*pn I have denied the desires of the poor or*ld let the eyes of the widow grow weary,
if*ln I have kept my bread to myself, not*ld sharing it with the fatherless—
but*ln from my youth I reared them as a father would, and*ld from my birth I guided the widow—

“If*pn I have rejoiced at my enemy’s misfortune or*ld gloated over the trouble that came to him—
I*ln have not allowed my mouth to sin by*ld invoking a curse against their life—
